page.title: 06St.Mary's Church, Rawmarsh
page.content: {St.Mary's,}the parish church of Rawmarsh, was built in 1839. On its electoral roll today are{150 people. On average about 6 baptisms, 2 weddings and 15 funerals take place each month. The Rector for the last four years has been{Father Aldridge}who has two assistants, Father Harboard and Father Sage. An extension costing Â£17,000 and an upstairs room, used as a meeting room and a choir vestry, were completed by Easter,1985 as was the redecoration of the church. The church is also used as a centre for clubs and 'discos' and as a meeting place for Girl Guides and Brownies. The{Rectory}was recently sold, as the Church rules prohibit the keeping of old buildings, and a new one built.
